summary: The Byrds were an American rock band formed in 1964 in Los Angeles. They were known for their unique sound, combining folk and rock music, and for their beautiful harmony singing. The band's leader was Roger McGuinn, and they had many hit songs like "Turn! Turn! Turn!" and "Mr. Tambourine Man." The Byrds influenced many other bands and helped create new types of music, like psychedelic rock and country rock. They went through many lineup changes, but the original members were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1991.
title: The Byrds
